banner.title: TP WorkLife 10/12
banner.mainContentHeadline: The podcast where science meets business
banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: A vibrant dance performance of funk classics

nodes.whoTheyAre: Dutch twin sisters Norah and Yarah along with younger sister Rosa share a passion for vibrant dance that led to the formation of Let It Happen.
nodes.whyListen: Let It Happen were twice featured on The Ellen DeGeneres Show. In 2019, the group performed alongside singer Anderson. Paak at his signature .Paak House in the Park event in Los Angeles. The sisters have also shared the stage with Justin Bieber and had their talent  recognized by Usher, Common, Taraji P Henson, Janet Jackson, Viola Davis, LL Cool J, Jennifer Garner and Ellen DeGeneres, among  others. Additionally, their dancing style was featured by Nike's during their launch of the 2019 Air Force One, and during the Jingle Jangle Christmas movie campaign for Netflix. They have been winners and finalists in dozens of international dance competitions since 2014.

videoData.description: Let It Happen, a dance trio comprised of Dutch twin sisters Norah and Yarah along with younger sister Rosa, light up the TED stage to remixes of funk classics "Get On the Good Foot" by James Brown and "Hit the Road Jack" by Ray Charles.
videoData.socialDescription: Let It Happen, a dance trio comprised of Dutch twin sisters Norah and Yarah along with younger sister Rosa, light up the TED stage to remixes of funk classics "Get On the Good Foot" by James Brown and "Hit the Road Jack" by Ray Charles.
